main_definition: Finals refer to the last exams or evaluations in a series, typically at the end of an academic period such as high school or college.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Last examinations conducted at the conclusion of a semester or school year
meanings_and_examples.example: The students were nervous about their finals in December.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The last phase of any process, competition, or event
meanings_and_examples.example: The chess tournament reached its final stage with only two competitors left.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used to describe the ultimate version or state of something
meanings_and_examples.example: She worked on her project and was pleased with the finals results, showing all improvements she made.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The last stage in a series of events or performances
meanings_and_examples.example: The play had four acts, but the audience eagerly anticipated the finals performance.
